intro: Chionopappus benthamii, commonly known as the White Rayed Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its white ray florets and yellow disk flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces a slender, branched stem that supports its showy flower heads. Chionopappus benthamii is a member of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower structure and medicinal potential.
